result.execSummary:
The defendant Demarco D Mallit was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Harboring/Aiding a Felon, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.47(1)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property >$2500-$5000, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consec to 08CF1373-Racine Co.  Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.  Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

superMiscConds.notes: DA has 90 days to prepare/submit order.

$250 DNA surcharge remitted. $268  to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervison or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.
Defendant not to use or possess any weapon.

Defendant shall not use/possess drug paraphernalia and/or controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with DM, EN, EB, KH, MT, JMS or ARS.

Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals related to prioritized need areas identified.  Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample.  Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.

supervisions.notes: Consec to ct 14.  To be served in WPS pursuant to sec. 973.03(2).
Court costs remitted. Costs in the amount of $92 VW surcharge  in Count #1 of Case #14CF437 to be collected by Dept of Corrections as a condition of probation.

Court entered not guilty plea for defendant. Motions due 20 days. Bail continued.
Br 15

Defendant Demarco D Mallit in court with attorney William Richard Jones. Prosecuting Atty Matthew Daniel Moeser appeared for State of Wisconsin. State requests court find counts transactionally related. No objection by DE. Court so finds. Officer Sarah Boespflug duly sworn and testified. Exhibit 1 - criminal complaint, marked. State moves for admission of pages 14-16, no objection, admitted. Detective Gregg Luetke duly sworn and testified. State moves for paragraph beginning on page 16 and running onto page 17 into evidence, no objection, admitted. Detective Tom Helgren duly sworn and testified. DE identified. State moves for page 18 of exhibit 1 into evidence, partial objection by DE, court admits all but paragraph relating to photograph. State moves for bind over. Argument by parties. Court finds PC.
Preliminary hearing on March 25, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Co-defendant requests set over and waived time limits. DE waives his time limits as well. Court set of PH.
